slideText: Hey, my name is Austin Williams! ðŸ‘‹
I applied to be a part of the GoDaddy team because I love web development and want to experience the best practices that your organization has to offer.
I've built a small demo using the React library to show you my excitement for this opportunity, and that I'm a great fit for your development team and technology stack.

This demo isn't meant to wow anyone, but to prove my competency with the React library. It's data driven â€” entirely fueled by a single JSON file â€” and rendered on screen using stateful components.

Single page applications are tons of fun to make, and I would love to work on them more with your team! I have experience writing and maintaining them from past employment, and I teach bootcamp students enrolled at the University of Washington on the basics of SPAs (as well as other core full-stack web development concepts).
Here's the source code for this demo: github.com/au-williams/react.

Software development is my passion and I love learning new things. That's always been the driving force behind my career. I taught myself computers at a young age by following my interests, and Iâ€™m confident in my skills regardless of the stack being used.

I spend my free time writing projects for fun â€” whether they are websites, programs, or games â€” and have a lifetime subscription to Pluralsight that I use to stay compentent with the latest and greatest technologies.
My resume is always available to view at resume.austinwilliams.dev, and you can contact me by email at me@austinwilliams.dev. I would love to hear from you!
This concludes my short demo. Thank you so much for your time today and the opportunity to work at GoDaddy! ðŸ˜„
